message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS. 

The paper deals with the problem of constructing secure index codes, which involves the use of information theory (cs.IT) and cryptography (cs.CR). The presence of an eavesdropper and the need for security against it suggest the sub-category of network security (cs.NI). The use of side information and the construction of codes suggest the sub-category of coding theory (cs.SI). Finally, the problem of constructing index codes involves optimization and algorithmic techniques, which suggest the sub-category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
